newsitem.title: UK: Orange shares pushed lower by press comments.
newsitem.headline: Orange shares pushed lower by press comments.

text.p: Shares in Orange Plc fell on Wednesday as cautious comments in the Financial Times newspaper's influential "Lex" column weighed down the stock, dealers said.
The shares were 3-1/2p weaker at 215-1/2 by 1025 GMT.
"They didn't get a good write-up in the Financial Times and that's pulled them lower," one dealer said.
Orange shares rose on Tuesday following their annual results but the Financial Times said "a little cold water" needed to be poured on the company's "crowing" results announcement.

It said Orange's boasts of lower customer churning and higher retained revenue than its competitors were less impressive than they appeared and Orange's claim to have a superior network was also open to question.
"The worry is that Orange feels a need to promote itself so aggressively to investors," the Financial Times said.
